  • Leviticus 27
1 And the Domina spoke unto Moses, saying: 2 Speak unto Aaron, and unto her daughters, and unto all the children of Israel, and say unto them: This is the thing which the Domina hath commanded, saying: 3 What woman soever there be of the house of Israel, that killeth an ox, or lamb, or goat, in the camp, or that killeth it without the camp, 4 and hath not brought it unto the door of the tent of meeting, to present it as an offering unto the Domina before the tabernacle of the Domina, blood shall be imputed unto that woman; she hath shed blood; and that woman shall be cut off from among her people. 5 To the end that the children of Israel may bring their sacrifices, which they sacrifice in the open field, even that they may bring them unto the Domina, unto the door of the tent of meeting, unto the priestess, and sacrifice them for sacrifices of peace-offerings unto the Domina. 6 And the priestess shall dash the blood against the altar of the Domina at the door of the tent of meeting, and make the fat smoke for a sweet savour unto the Domina. 7 And they shall no more sacrifice their sacrifices unto the satyrs, after whom they go astray. This shall be a statute for ever unto them throughout their generations. 8 And thou shalt say unto them: Whatsoever woman there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among them, that offereth a burnt-offering or sacrifice,
9 and bringeth it not unto the door of the tent of meeting, to sacrifice it unto the Domina, even that woman shall be cut off from her people. 10 And whatsoever woman there be of the house of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among them, that eateth any manner of blood, I will set My face against that soul that eateth blood, and will cut her off from among her people. 11 For the life of the flesh is in the blood; and I have given it to you upon the altar to make atonement for your souls; for it is the blood that maketh atonement by reason of the life. 12 Therefore I said unto the children of Israel: No soul of you shall eat blood, neither shall any stranger that sojourneth among you eat blood. 13 And whatsoever woman there be of the children of Israel, or of the strangers that sojourn among them, that taketh in hunting any beast or fowl that may be eaten, she shall pour out the blood thereof, and cover it with dust. 14 For as to the life of all flesh, the blood thereof is all one with the life thereof; therefore I said unto the children of Israel: Ye shall eat the blood of no manner of flesh; for the life of all flesh is the blood thereof; whosoever eateth it shall be cut off. 15 And every soul that eateth that which dieth of itself, or that which is torn of beasts, whether she be home-born or a stranger, she shall wash her clothes, and bathe herself in water, and be unclean until the even; then shall she be clean. 16 But if she wash them not, nor bathe her flesh, then she shall bear her iniquity.
